00040 /*
00041  * trackball.h
00042  * A virtual trackball implementation
00043  * Written by Gavin Bell for Silicon Graphics, November 1988.
00044  */
00045 
00046 /*
00047  * Pass the x and y coordinates of the last and current positions of
00048  * the mouse, scaled so they are from (-1.0 ... 1.0).
00049  *
00050  * The resulting rotation is returned as a quaternion rotation in the
00051  * first paramater.
00052  */
00053 SURFIT_EXPORT
00054 void
00055 trackball(float q[4], float p1x, float p1y, float p2x, float p2y);
00056 
00057 /*
00058  * Given two quaternions, add them together to get a third quaternion.
00059  * Adding quaternions to get a compound rotation is analagous to adding
00060  * translations to get a compound translation.  When incrementally
00061  * adding rotations, the first argument here should be the new
00062  * rotation, the second and third the total rotation (which will be
00063  * over-written with the resulting new total rotation).
00064  */
00065 SURFIT_EXPORT
00066 void
00067 add_quats(float *q1, float *q2, float *dest);
00068 
00069 /*
00070  * A useful function, builds a rotation matrix in Matrix based on
00071  * given quaternion.
00072  */
00073 SURFIT_EXPORT
00074 void
00075 build_rotmatrix(float m[4][4], float q[4]);
00076 
00077 /*
00078  * This function computes a quaternion based on an axis (defined by
00079  * the given vector) and an angle about which to rotate.  The angle is
00080  * expressed in radians.  The result is put into the third argument.
00081  */
00082 SURFIT_EXPORT
00083 void
00084 axis_to_quat(float a[3], float phi, float q[4]);
00085 
00086 #endif


surfit-1.0.0pre
